title: A2141 audio issue 820-01700
message:
Hello, I’m working on 2019 16 820-01700 everything works fine, except speakers sounded awful, I have see this issue before , usually replacing the audio ics fixes the problem, but board I’m working on for past 2 days in between work now has no sound at all now, no sound issue started after replacing U6520, went from popping to no sound at all,  inhave reballed and replaced u6520 3 times, u6500 twice and u6560 once, all 3 chips on left side have been  replaced chips were pulled from logicboard with no sound issue, donor board had  sleep wake issue, but verified good audio
Anyhow I’m stumped, if I close the lid and open again I will have audio on the side that wasn’t touched yet, but sound is low, and popping sound is still present, 
Curious where to start,

title: A2141 audio issue 820-01700
message:
[QUOTE="Donlan78, post: 96116, member: 44787"]
Hello, I’m working on 2019 16 820-01700 everything works fine, except speakers sounded awful, I have see this issue before , usually replacing the audio ics fixes the problem, but board I’m working on for past 2 days in between work now has no sound at all now, no sound issue started after replacing U6520, went from popping to no sound at all,  inhave reballed and replaced u6520 3 times, u6500 twice and u6560 once, all 3 chips on left side have been  replaced chips were pulled from logicboard with no sound issue, donor board had  sleep wake issue, but verified good audio
Anyhow I’m stumped, if I close the lid and open again I will have audio on the side that wasn’t touched yet, but sound is low, and popping sound is still present,
Curious where to start,
[/QUOTE]

ppbus_g3h is low 12.37v on c6555 and all the plbis caps near the audio ics
Pretty’s sure this is the problem, and it’s obvious something. Is dragging it down 
Just not sure how to find the fault in this situation 
Don’t  think I can inject voltage to see what’s warm, 

Any suggestion would be great, client is supposed to pick up Thursday, I’m not sure how I missed  the audio popping originally, but it is what it is, I have a much bigger problem now  (functional  but no sound)

title: A2141 audio issue 820-01700
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What said the client about how the problem appeared?
Check ANGLE_SENSOR_ND/MGL and LID_OPEN_SMC_IN, when lid is closed/open.

BTW, write directly into reply box, instead of clicking Reply button.
I don't see a reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...

bedudes the lid sensor is there away to test which audio ic is failing 

the macbook works perfect other than popping sound when playing video,the no sound tilllidnis closed and opened only fixes sound in the left side speakers, the right side have no sound at all
